entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Colville River This Week... Runoff from heavy rainfall over the upper Colville River Basin will be moving downriver this week. Between 1.00 to 1.75 inches of rain fell between Sunday morning to Monday morning in the foothills of the Brooks Range. Water levels will rise significantly and may approach bankfull in some low lying areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northwestern Brooks Range

At 525 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northwest of Winchester, which is also 15 miles west of Worland, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:25PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hot Springs County through 600 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Anchor Dam, which is also 26 miles south of Meeteetse, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail.
